linefit.IO

Class GeneralIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • linefit.IO.GeneralIO

  • public class GeneralIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class Handles the general IO operations of LineFit so that the rest of the code does not need to worry about handling these operations
    Since:
    0.99.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ChangeTracker changeTracker
      The object that keeps track of if any changes have been made
      ExportIO exportIO
      The object that handles the exporting functionality of LineFit
      private javax.swing.JFileChooser fileChooser
      The JFileChooser that allows the user to select files to open or import with a GUI
      LineFitFileIO fileIO
      The object that handles the file IO functionality of LineFit
      private LineFit lineFit
      The LineFit instance that this IOHandler is linked to
      private static java.awt.image.BufferedImage lineFitIcon
      The Icon as a BufferedImage that is used for any JFrames created in the lineFit program
      private static java.util.prefs.Preferences lineFitUserPreferences
      The user's preferences for LineFit so we can store things like the last opened directory
      private int saveBeforeClosingDialogChoice
      The returned value from the dialog box that asks the user if they want to save before exiting LineFit if there are unsaved changed (The dirtyBit is dirty/true)
      private static java.lang.String USER_PREFERENCES_DEFAULT_DIRECTORY
      Stores the user's last used directory so they do not have to navigate from the root directory
      private static java.lang.String USER_PREFERENCES_DEFAULT_DIRECTORY_KEY
      Stores the key for finding the user's last used directory so we can access the data
      private static java.lang.String USER_PREFERENCES_DEFAULT_OS
      Stores the user's Operating System they used
      private static java.lang.String USER_PREFERENCES_DEFAULT_OS_KEY
      Stores the key for finding the user's operating system so we can access the data

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeneralIO(LineFit lineFitToAssociateWith)
      The constructor for LineFitFileIO that creates a new instance of ChangeTracker to track if the data has changed and that uses the passed LineFIT instance and Graph

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeApplication()
      Closes ourself in a safe way that asks the user if they want to save if there are unsaved changes

      Makes sure the filename ends with the given extension and if it does not it adds the extension to the end of the file

      Gets the LineFit Icon Image to be used throughout the program and loads it into memory if it already isn't

      Gets the folder that the user was last in so we can start our file chooser there

      Checks to see if a newer version of LineFit is available and if so, prompts the user to download it

      Opens a blank instance of LineFit in a new separate window.

      Starts a new instance of LineFit and attempts to loads the data from the file path passed Note: This will only work if it is running from a JAR file

      Opens a prompt that allows users to select a file that is then returned

      Stores the current directory the user is in for the file chooser so we do not have to navigate from scratch each time

      • isUpdateAvailable

        public void isUpdateAvailable(boolean alwaysPopUpResult)
        Checks to see if a newer version of LineFit is available and if so, prompts the user to download it
        Parameters:
        alwaysPopUpResult - True if the result of the check should always be displayed (i.e. if the user initiated it)

      • newLineFitInstancePromptForFile

        public void newLineFitInstancePromptForFile()
        Prompts the user for a LineFit file to open and then attempts to open it in a new LineFit instance Note: This will only work if it is running from a JAR file

      • newLineFitInstance

        public void newLineFitInstance(java.lang.String pathToFile)
        Starts a new instance of LineFit and attempts to loads the data from the file path passed Note: This will only work if it is running from a JAR file
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - The path of the LineFit file to open in the new instance of LineFit
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Throws this exception if it expected to find a number while parsing the file and found something else

      • newLineFitInstance

        public void newLineFitInstance()
        Opens a blank instance of LineFit in a new separate window. Note: This will only work if it is running from a JAR file

      • showPDFHelpFile

        public void showPDFHelpFile()
        Creates and displays or just displays the LineFit help PDF file

      • copyResourceFileToContainingFolder

        public void copyResourceFileToContainingFolder(java.lang.String fileName,
                                               java.lang.String destinationFolderPath)
        Creates a copy of the passed file in the resources folder into the given directory
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the resource to copy to the folder that the jar is in
        destinationFolderPath - The path to put the created resource at. This must contain the ending "\\" to denote a folder

      • showSaveFileDialog

        public java.io.File showSaveFileDialog(java.lang.String extensionToPutOnFile)
                                throws CloseDialogException
        Shows the save file dialog that allows us to specify where to save our data and what to call it
        Parameters:
        extensionToPutOnFile - The file extension to save the file with
        Returns:
        The File that this LineFit's data will be saved to
        Throws:
        CloseDialogException - throws this error if the save dialog was closed out of

      • forceExtension

        public java.io.File forceExtension(java.io.File fileToForceExtensionOn,
                                   java.lang.String extensionToPutOnFile)
        Makes sure the filename ends with the given extension and if it does not it adds the extension to the end of the file
        Parameters:
        fileToForceExtensionOn - The File to force the extension on
        extensionToPutOnFile - The extension to force onto the File
        Returns:
        The File with the extension forced on it

      • getStoredOperatingSystem

      • storedOSisCurrentOS

        private boolean storedOSisCurrentOS()
        Checks to make sure the OS we have stored is the one we are using
        Returns:
        True if the stored operating system is the same as the one we are using and false otherwise

      • savePreferences

        private void savePreferences()

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The file that the user has selected or null if the operation was canceled
